contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone had written on both its front and its back" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it had been written on both its front and back

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "since you warned him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: since he was warned

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "People will no longer worship at your altars and your enemy will destroy your pillars" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Then your altars will become desolate and your pillars will be destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "Enemy armies will lay waste your cities" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: cities will be laid waste

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "enemy armies will break your altars" or "enemy armies will break them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they will be broken

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. See how you translated "pillars" in [Ezekiel 6:4](../06/04.md). Alternate translation: "they will cut down your pillars" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: your pillars will be cut down

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "no one will remember what you have done" or "they will destroy everything you have made" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: your works will be wiped away

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "when I scatter you in different countries" or "when I force you to live in other countries" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: when you are scattered throughout the countries

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will not strengthen any of them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: none of them will be strengthened

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "they will not be able to satisfy their hunger" or "they will still be hungry even after they eat all they have" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: their hunger will not be satisfied

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "enemies will defile the places where they worship" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: their holy places will be defiled!

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "Whirling" means "Spinning." Here it is the name of the wheels. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone called the wheels, 'Whirling.'" or "the name of the wheels was 'Whirling.'" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the wheels were called, "Whirling."

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "But I am going to bring you out" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: But you are going to be brought out

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The people living in Jerusalem say about all of them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: All of them are those of whom it is said by those living in Jerusalem

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh has given this land to us as our possession" or "This land has become our possession" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: This land was given to us as our possession

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "where I scattered you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: where you were scattered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "just as Yahweh commanded me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: just as I was commanded

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "them" refers to the people living in Jerusalem. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "so others will do to them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: so it will be done to them

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "fullness" refers to everything in the land. The word "despoiled" means that people will empty the land of everything in it. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "others will empty the land of everything in it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the land will be despoiled of its fullness

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the cities where people lived will be desolate" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the cities that were inhabited will be desolate

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will fulfill every vision" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: every vision will be fulfilled

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will no longer delay the word I have spoken" or "I will no longer delay doing what I said I would do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: My words will not be delayed any longer

contextId.occurrenceNote: This probably refers to an official record of the citizens of Israel. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "nor will anyone enroll their names in the record of the house of Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: or enrolled in the record of the house of Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they could only rescue their own lives" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: only their own lives would be rescued

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they would only rescue their own lives" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: only their own lives would be rescued

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they would only rescue their own lives" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: only their own lives would be rescued

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they will comfort you concerning the punishment" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: be comforted concerning the punishment

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "If a person throws it into a fire as fuel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: If it is thrown into a fire as fuel

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "your parents threw you out into the open field" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you were thrown out into the open field

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I adorned you with gold and silver, and dressed you in fine linen" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you were adorned with gold and silver, and you were dressed in fine linen

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will humiliate you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you will be humiliated

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will restore your sister Sodom and her daughters to their former condition" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: your sister Sodom and her daughters will be restored to their former condition

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will restore your sister Samaria and her daughters to their former estate" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Samaria and her daughters will be restored to their former estate

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will restore you and your daughters to your former condition" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you and your daughters will be restored to your former condition

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "before you revealed your wickedness" or "before I revealed your wickedness" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: before your wickedness was revealed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that I made with you when you were young" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: made in the days of your youth

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "from the place that the first eagle had planted it so that it would have water" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: from the place it had been planted so it would be watered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The first eagle had planted the vine" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It had been planted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will catch him in my hunting net" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he will be caught in my hunting net

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the ones who remain alive will flee in every direction" or "the enemy soldiers will scatter in every directions the ones who remain alive" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the ones who remain will be scattered in every direction

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They caught him in their trap" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: He was caught in their trap

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "People abandoned the land and its fullness" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The land and its fullness were abandoned

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They caught him in their trap" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: He was caught in their trap

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people would no longer hear his voice" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: his voice would no longer be heard

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "branches strong enough that people used them for rulers' scepters" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: strong branches that were used for rulers' scepters

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people could see how tall it was by the greatness of its foliage" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: its height was seen by the greatness of its foliage

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh uprooted the vine in fury and threw it down" or "people uprooted the vine in fury and threw it down" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the vine was uprooted in fury and thrown down

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh broke off its strong branches and they withered" or "People broke off its strong branches and they withered" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Its strong branches were broken off and withered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you must sing it as a lamentation" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will be sung as a lamentation

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "so that the people would not profane it in the eyes of the nations" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: so it would not be profaned in the eyes of the nations

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. See how you translated this in [Ezekiel 20:9](../20/09.md). Alternate translation: "so that the people would not profane it in the eyes of the nations" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: so it would not be profaned in the eyes of the nations

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. See how you translated this in [Ezekiel 20:9](../20/09.md). Alternate translation: "so that the people would not profane it in the eyes of the nations" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: so it would not be profaned in the eyes of the nations

contextId.occurrenceNote: The name "Bamah" means "high place," a place for worshiping idols. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people have called that place Bamah" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the name is called Bamah

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "among whom I have scattered you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: among whom you have been scattered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "where I have scattered you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: where you have been scattered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The fiery flame will not go out" or "No one will be able to quench the fiery flame" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The fiery flame will not be quenched

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the fire will burn every face from the south to the north" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: every face from the south to the north will be burned

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "it will not go out" or "no one will quench it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it will not be quenched

contextId.occurrenceNote: This phrase indicates that the sword is ready for someone to use it. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "It is sharp and polished" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It will be sharpened and polished

contextId.occurrenceNote: These can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will sharpen it ... I will polish it so that it will" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It will be sharpened ... It will be polished in order to

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will polish the sword" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the sword will be given to be polished

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "then the right person will hold it in his hand" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: then to be grasped by the hand

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "it is ready for the killer to use" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it is to be given into the hand of the one who kills

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "It is a sword for slaughtering people" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: A sword for the ones to be slaughtered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "It is a sword for slaughtering many people" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It is a sword for the many to be slaughtered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. The "enemy's hand" represents the enemy's control. Alternate translation: "your enemy will take you in his hand" or "your enemies will capture you and take you into captivity" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: you will be taken in hand

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the one comes who I assign" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the one comes who is assigned

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "who are about to die" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who are about to be killed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "No one will remember you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: You will not be remembered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. The word "land" here refers to Israel and to the people who live there. Alternate translation: "You are a land and a people that is unclean" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: You are a land that has not been cleansed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "and profane me among themselves" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: so that I am profaned in their midst

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Men squeezed their breasts" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Their breasts were squeezed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They will reveal your nakedness" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: your nakedness will be uncovered

contextId.occurrenceNote: "These things will be done to you because you have acted." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "These things will happen to you because you have acted" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: These things will be done to you in your acting

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. The word "Sabeans" refers to people from Sheba. Alternate translation: "Sabeans had come" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-names]])
contextId.glQuote: Sabeans were brought

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "for the company to terrorize and plunder them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to be terrorized and plundered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "so that no one could cover it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: so it could not be covered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "burn the bones" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: let the bones be charred

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "to melt the uncleanness within it and to consume its corrosion" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: so its uncleanness within it will be melted, its corrosion consumed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Ezekiel being given understanding and the ability to speak is represented by his mouth being opened. Alternate translation: "I will open your mouth" or "you will know what to say" or "I will cause you to know what to say" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: your mouth will be opened up

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "against my sanctuary when the enemy army profaned it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: over my sanctuary when it was profaned

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "so that the nations will not remember the people of Ammon" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: so that the people of Ammon will not be remembered among the nations

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The enemy armies will slaughter with swords her daughters who are in the fields" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Her daughters who are in the fields will be slaughtered by the swords

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "after breaking down its walls" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: whose walls have been broken down

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "No one will hear the sound of your harps anymore" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The sound of your harps will be heard no more

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will make you a place where nets" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you will become a place where nets

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "How your enemies have destroyed youyou who were inhabited by sailors" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: How you, who were inhabited by sailors, have been destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The ships of Tarshish carried your merchandise" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The ships of Tarshish were the transporters of your merchandise

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be expressed in active form. Alternate translation: "who its enemies have now silenced" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who has now been brought to silence

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be expressed in active form. Alternate translation: "When people brought your merchandise ashore" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: When your merchandise went ashore

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be expressed in active form. Alternate translation: "when the seas, the deep waters, shattered you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: when you were shattered by the seas, by deep waters

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I prepared them on the day that I created you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It was on the day you were created that they were prepared

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "since the day that I created you until I found injustice within you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: from the day you were created until injustice was found within you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will reveal my glory among you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I will be glorified in your midst

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will use you to show you that I am holy" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I will be shown to be holy in you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be expressed in active form. Alternate translation: "among whom I scattered them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: among whom they were scattered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. The implication is that they would die in the wilderness. Alternate translation: "no one will gather you or pick you up" or "no one will gather your bodies and bury you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: you will not be gathered nor lifted up

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "among whom I scattered them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: among whom they were scattered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "when the attackers destroy the foundations of the buildings in Egypt" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: when her foundations are ruined

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I destroy all of the allies of Egypt" or "when armies destroy all of those who help Egypt" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: all of her helpers are destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will bring Nebuchadnezzar and his army ... to destroy the land" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: He and his army with him ... will be brought to destroy the land

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will cause him and his army ... to go destroy the land of Egypt" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: He and his army ... will be brought to destroy the land

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "enemies will break up the walls and buildings in Thebes" or "enemies will destroy the Thebes" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Thebes will be broken up

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "No one has bound up his arm" or "No one has wrapped up his arm" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It has not been bound up

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. And the abstract noun "death" can be stated "die." Alternate translation: "For I made it so that they all will die and go deep under the ground" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: All of them have been assigned to death, to the earth below

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "sword" represents enemies who fought them in battle. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom enemies had killed with swords" or "who had died in battle" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: who had been killed by the sword

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "For I will bring you down" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: For you will be brought down

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be put into active form. Alternate translation: "I will let all the animals of the earth eat your body until they are hungry no longer" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the hunger of all living animals on earth will be satisfied by you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be put into active form. Alternate translation: "I will fill the streams with your blood" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the stream beds will be filled with your blood

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be put into active form. Alternate translation: "When I make the land of Egypt a place where no one is living" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: When I make the land of Egypt an abandoned place

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "sword" is a metonym for a soldier who kills people with a sword.This can be put into active form. Alternate translation: "whom enemy soldiers killed with swords" or "who died in battle" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: who were killed by the sword

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be put in active form. Alternate translation: "I have given Egypt to the sword" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: She has been given to the sword

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be put in active form. Alternate translation: "all those whom enemies killed in battle" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: all of those who were killed, who fell by the sword

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be put in active form. Alternate translation: "Her enemies killed them all" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: all of them were killed

contextId.occurrenceNote: "Broken" here represents "destroyed." This can be put in active form. Alternate translation: "I will destroy you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: you ... will be broken

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be put in active form. Alternate translation: "Others will lay him in the midst of the uncircumcised" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he will be laid down in the midst of the uncircumcised

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "and he does not warn the people" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: with the result that the people are not warned

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "the city" refers to "Jerusalem." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The Babylonians have destroyed Jerusalem" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The city has been captured

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh has given us the land" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The land has been given to us

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "no one will live in the mountains of Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the mountains of Israel will be deserted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that someone plays very well on a stringed instrument" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that is well played on a stringed instrument

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Then they scattered because they did not have a shepherd" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Then they were scattered without a shepherd

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in the active form. Alternate translation: "because all the beasts in the fields steal my flock and eat them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: because my flock has become plunder and food for all the beasts in the fields

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will not allow anyone to plunder them" or "I will not allow anyone to steal them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they will no longer be plunder

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "sword" represents enemies who fought them in battle. This can be stated in active form. See how you translated this in [Ezekiel 31:17](../31/17.md). Alternate translation: "those whom enemies have killed with swords" or "those who have died in battle" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: those who were killed by the sword

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. This may be an exaggeration for emphasis. Alternate translation: "People will not live in your cities" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: Your cities will not be inhabited

contextId.occurrenceNote: This phrase can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They are in ruins" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They have been destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the cities that people have left behind" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the forsaken cities

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "my people, Israel, will plow your ground and sow it with seed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you will be plowed and sown with seed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Then people will live in the cities and will rebuild the ruins" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The cities will be inhabited and the ruins rebuilt

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people to live on you mountains as they did before" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you to be inhabited as you previously were

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I dispersed them through the lands" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they were dispersed through the lands

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "For Yahweh has forced them out of his land" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: For they have been thrown out of his land

contextId.occurrenceNote: "know this" or "you can be sure of this." Yahweh says this to emphasize that it is not because the people are good that he will restore them. This phrase can be moved to the beginning of the verse. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: let this be known to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Possible meanings are 1) Alternate translation: "that enemies had torn down" or 2) Alternate translation: "that people could not get into" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that were torn down

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the people have now rebuilt them and have started living there again" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: are now fortified and inhabited

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "is set apart" can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Like the great number of sheep that the people set apart for sacrifices or bring to Jerusalem for the appointed feasts" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Like the flock is set apart for sacrifices, like the flock in Jerusalem at her appointed feasts

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "as Yahweh had commanded me to speak" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: as I was commanded

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "these people that enemies and disasters have killed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: these who have been killed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "as Yahweh had commanded me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: as I was commanded

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will call you to come for war" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: You will be called

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that I have gathered together" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that has been gathered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will bring the Israelites out" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the land's people will be brought out

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh will make mountains fall down" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The mountains will be thrown down

contextId.occurrenceNote: That can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they all became fat while grazing in Bashan" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they were all fattened in Bashan

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "the Babylonians captured the city of Jerusalem" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the city was captured

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they killed the burnt offering" or "they killed the animals that they would burn as an offering" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the burnt offering was slaughtered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they would put the flesh of the offerings on the tables" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the flesh of the offerings would be put on the tables

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "no one will open it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it will not be opened

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "that they need to do in it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that is done in it

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "or any creature that a bird or a wild animal has torn apart" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: or animal torn by a beast, whether bird or beast

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "that you gave for the holy place" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: reserved for the holy place

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "you will use for" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will be used for

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the Levites will open the gate facing east for him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the gate facing east will be opened for him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "a river that no one could cross on foot" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a river that could not be crossed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "The leaders of the Israelites will assign land to the priests" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The priests will have land assigned to them
